One hundred years ago, a group of Chicago White Sox players attempted to throw the World Series, creating a scandal that ended their careers and changed the sport forever. Deadball: Year III allows you to simulate a game or series in which one or more of the players on the field are deliberately trying to lose, and to find out how it feels to throw the most important games of your life.

Along with the rules for fixing a series, Year III includes:


     An oddities table that seamlessly integrates incidents like balks, fan interference, botched calls, and animals on the field—without slowing down play
     New rules to simulate modern bullpen usage


A revised Deadball scoresheet that makes it easier than ever to keep track of the action

     Rosters for the notorious All Stars of the Steroid Era


A history of baseball’s bans and blacklists by John Thorn, the official historian of Major League Baseball; a meditation on losing on purpose by USA Today’s Ted Berg, and a poem about the dead ball era by Nicole Callihan

In Year III, cheaters never prosper—but they still have a marvelous time.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zombie World: Enclave Expansion – The Farm
Description:
From the back of the box:

Welcome to the Farm.

Keep your fields sown and your fences strong, and maybe you'll have a shot.  Just so long as the dead don't decide to come wandering through those trees.

The Farm Enclave Expansion for ZOMBIE WORLD adds a whole new enclave you can use in any session of the tabletop roleplaying game, with new options, characters, and possibilities for your game.

INCLUDES: 18 Population Cards, 27 Identity Cards, 4 Advantage Cards, 4 Fate Cards, 2 Enclave Cards

Name: April 18 1943: Kill Yamamoto !!!
Description:
The fourth volume of the series The propeller rotates and the engine roars. This volume is dedicated to the clashes between the USAAF and the Dai-Nippon Teikoku Kaigun Koku Hombu, the Imperial Japanese Naval Air Force and it recreates the surprise attack of the P-38 Lightning to the planes carrying Admiral Yamamoto on April 18th 1943.

Will you manage to shoot him down or the Imperial Admiral will survive for another Pearl Harbour?

You just need 2d6!

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: The Propeller Rotates and the Engine Roars (Lumaca Games)

Name: Frozen Wings
Description:
Frozen Wings is the third Volume dedicated to the air struggles between the Italian Regia Aeronautica with its MC200 Saetta and BR20 Cicogna against the Voyenno-Vozdushnye Sily (the Soviet Air Force), with its I-16 and YAK1 in the early stages of the invasion of the Soviet Union.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: The Propeller Rotates and the Engine Roars (Lumaca Games)

Name: Middara: Tomoe Resin Kit
Description:
Middara: Tomoe is a cross promotion with the Axis Mundi and their wandering miko, Tomoe! Tomoe is a character from their miniatures game Sankokushin: Five Sacrifices.

The Tomoe kit comes with a beautiful resin miniature (that will require assembly), an Initiative Card, a Discipline Card, an Equipment Card, and an Adventurer Card.

The model kit is unpainted and must be assembled using your own glue and supplies. The cards that come with the figure are additional game content that can be used in the Crawl Mode or shuffled into their corresponding decks.

Name: Stukas over Malta
Description:
The fifth Scenario of the new game The propeller rotates and the engine roars simulating the actions of the Italian Royal Air Force (la Regia Aeronautica) during the II World War.

This Volume is again about the air battles over the sky of Malta but this time the Luftwaffe has arrived! Now the mighty JU87 Stuka will try to bomb the valiant fortress, defended by the first Spitfires... but beware of the Bf109 and the Italian fighters!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: The Propeller Rotates and the Engine Roars (Lumaca Games)

Name: Attacco a Malta
Description:
Attacco a Malta is a solitaire game on the unlucky Italian raid in the English Navy base in Malta on 25-26 July 1941. It can be played solitaire or in two players, each one controlling one of the attacking units, Barchini and SLC.

—description from the publisher

Attacco a Malta è un gioco che simula lo sfortunato attacco effettuato dagli incursori della Decima Mas il 25-26 Luglio 1941 alla base inglese del Mediterraneo. Può essere giocato in solitario, ed allora il giocatore controllerà entrambe le unità Mezzi, oppure in due giocatori, ognuno dei quali controllerà una sola delle unità Mezzi.

—description from the publisher (Italian)

Name: London 1980: Operation NIMROD
Description:
London 1982 (sic) is a solitaire war game depicting the action, called Operation Nimrod, performed by SAS, one of the first British Special Forces, in the Iranian Embassy in London on May 5th 1980, where a group of terrorists had kept for 6 days several hostages. A daring operation, which was a success with the liberation of the hostages and the elimination of the terrorists, who were linked to the Democratic Revolutionary Front for the Liberation of Arabistan, a Iraqi backed separatist movement of the Khuzestan Iranian area.

81 fantastic counters, a gorgeous A3 map and English rules... you just need two d6!!!

—description from the publisher

Name: Occult
Description:
Occult is a fast-paced, chaotic card game for 2 to 5 players. Players are tasked with keeping their mythological monsters in play for three turns, or by slaying three of their opponent's monsters, to win the game.

Players can slay monsters using rare Banish cards, or by combining other basic cards to have even greater effects. In the base game, the Slayer, the Dancer, the Thief and the Merchant are all used as basic cards to have various effects: one when a single card of that type is discarded, and one when three cards of that type are discarded.

Each monster has their own effect as well when they enter play, causing chaos that may or may not benefit their controller.

With no additional tokens or dice, everything is tracked on the cards themselves by rotating them and therefore, Occult is the perfect pick-up-and-play card game!

—description from the designer

Name: Mogadishu 1977: Operation Feuerzauber
Description:
"Mogadishu 1977: Operation Feuerzauber" is a solitaire wargame depicting the action performed by GSG 9, one of the first West German Special Forces, in the airport of Mogadishu, Somalia, where a group of terrorists, who had hijacked a  Lufthansa Boing, were keeping as prisoners the crew and the passengers. A daring operation, far from the home bases several flight hours, which was a success with the liberation of the hostages and the elimination of the terrorists, who were linked to the RAF, the "Rot Armèe Fraktion".

An A3 map, 57 counters and English rules... you just need two d6.

—description from the publisher

Name: Middara: The Collector
Description:
The Collector Bounty Pack contains a Bounty Book, multiple new Initiative cards, two new Combatants, a new Boss Monster, new Monster Loot, and hidden Item cards for you to uncover. This Bounty Pack expansion will require Act 1 to play.

The Collector and his collection of that which he values most will keep you on your toes as your party ventures to purge the lands of Elenia from this scourge to humanity. Beyond where even the most venerable warriors dare stray. And whether you end up living triumphantly as heroes, or rotting away as dead memories written on the pages of history books. One way or another, Bounties will earn your party fame in Middara.

PERFECTION THROUGH ADVERSITY
Bounty Packs expand the Adventure Mode with insanely hard and uniquely diverse side quests. These Side Quests can be attempted at lower levels than the intended difficulty recommends for an even hard challenge.

Each Bounty Pack adds a side quest that can be attempted during specific moments of the Adventure Mode. The Bounties of Elenia line of Bounty Packs represent all of the horrible monstrosities that threaten the realms of Elenia.

Each Bounty Pack contains a plethora of new content. New tokens, a new Bounty Book, new miniatures, new tiles that expand old sets, new unique loot, new upgrades, as well as optional content to change the possible combatants that might spawn in the Unintentional Malum Core Game and Adventure Expansions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Middara: Unintentional Malum – Act 3
Description:
The second Adventure Expansion for Middara. Last part of the Unintentional Malum Trilogy.
Unintentional Malum Act 3 contains Adventure Book, Crawl Book, Diagram Book, Plastic Miniatures, new cards plus so much more! It comes with an insert that will allow you to store the entirety of the Unintentional Malum Trilogy in a single box. It will include a detachable token tray, slots for tiles and 5x6 cards, and trenches to keep all your (sleeved) cards stored for all 3 Acts.

THE STORY CONTINUES
These Adventure Expansions continue Unintentional Malum's epic story. These Expansions contain far more than your typical expansion pack. Each Adventure Expansion gives you a massive amount of content that rivals something close to even our original products that they expand. This is to provide the basis for what Middara is all about, story telling, character growth, and continuity.

Each Adventure Expansion gives you at least 40 additional hours of gameplay by extending not only the Base Game they require, but also the surrounding optional ways of playing Middara, including the Crawl Mode.

NEW LOCATIONS
Each Adventure Pack contains a plethora of beautiful tiles. You'll find airships, exotic floating tombs, deeper levels of the white vaults, and even other worldly locations.

MINIATURES & MONSTERS
The story continues as you take your characters into even higher levels of power and face off against even more dangerous and diverse creatures!
New weird creatures inhabit the world. Learn their lore, learn their weaknesses, and kill them.

MORE CRAWL MODE OPTIONS
Each Adventure Expansion contains a set of unique Crawl Mode adventures to play when you don't have time to enjoy the gigantic story. In addition, you'll find that the Crawl Mode's depth has been optionally expanded and it's balance and options more fine tuned for quick and efficient play for those who want that old school dungeon crawler experience.

—description from the publisher

Name: Middara: KS2 Promo Pack
Description:
This is half of the stretch goals for the kickstarter*


The KS2 Promo Pack contains promotional characters, esper upgrades, and associated cards from our second Middara Kickstarter campaign!

Includes:

Summoner Nyx + cards
Pocky + cards
Ai Chen + cards
Toast + cards

It also includes TWO miniature (previously standees) upgrades for the following Espers in Act 2 and 3:

Balaan
Sardonic Vultures
Yosia, Sister of Arkalla
Murder Advocate

Name: Middara: KS1 Promo Pack
Description:
Middara: KS1 Promo Pack is the promo box from the first Kickstarter campaign. It comes with contents not included in the Unintentional Malum base game.

This Promo Pack contains 2-3 player Variant cards, new characters, characters figures, new items and figures to replace some standees from Unintentional Malum Act 1.

2-3 PLAYER VARIANT: 2-3 player Variant cards for all the characters in Unintentional Malum Act 1.

NEW CHARACTERS: New characters (Nyx, Ballroom Shayliss, Black Wolf) come with unique Item cards, figures, Adventurer Cards, and Initiative Cards.

PIRATES OF ELENIA: Contains characters and antagonists miniatures for Pirates of Elenia Adventure Pack.

Name: Middara: Vile Variations Adventure Pack Expansion
Description:
Contains over 60 5x6 cards with corresponding initiative cards!

Variations represent new versions of existing monsters. This product contains new AI for the most common Combatants seen in Unintentional Malum.

Expand your replayability, game time, and challenges by introducing these Vile Combatants to your collection.

Requires Unintentional Malum: Act 1 to play.

Name: Fourth Millennium
Description:
In the year 2388, a group of university students working in the Tycho Crater settlement, New Pottsdam, invent the long-desired technology of a Faster Than Light (FTL) propulsion system.  (In this case, an Alcubierre design.)  Mankind expands outward in every direction, for 3000 light years, in the next 700 years.

It is now the year 3000 AD, and after a little less than 700 years of FTL technology, man has created a modest sphere of inhabited systems some 6000 light years in diameter, and a collective population nearing 1 trillion souls.  Many, many systems containing habitable worlds still remain to be explored and colonized within that sphere, yet the expansion relentlessly continues.   A few, planet-bound sapient races have been found, but no other race with space travel (much less FTL capability) has yet to be revealed.

But the Milky Way galaxy is a vast expanse of hundreds of billions of stars, and despite centuries of FTL drives, man has still only seen the smallest fraction of a single percentage point of those star systems.

Much, much more lies out there, not the least of which is other, star-faring races.  And of those, some are hopefully friendly and open-armed (in some cases, figuratively), some likely paranoid beyond reason, some simply convinced that any species other than their own must be eradicated, but most will likely fall in various places across the spectrum of possibilities.  The diplomatic skills of man will be sorely tested, as may his ability and will to wage interstellar warfare.

Fourth Millennium is a 4X game for 1 to 6 players, set on a map of the entire Milky Way galaxy – 100,000 light years in diameter – where each player will choose their own path in attempting to carve out the biggest and best empire, encountering a variety of 36, possible alien races, each with its own unique attributes, attitude, and aspirations, not to mention the empires being built by the other players.

Staying relevant technologically will prove a challenge.  Some alien races you encounter may be more advanced than you…and not happy about your presence on their doorstep.  Indeed, you may even need to ally with other players in order to whittle down a common threat.

And during your explorations, you may find multiple artifacts, left behind by a long-gone race.  They are key to understanding new technologies and improving your overall civilization.  But be forewarned. Those who left behind these artifacts - which we call "The Andromedans" - are still observing, may decide to intervene, and if so, with the sole intent of destroying all, competing star-faring races.

—description from the designer

Name: Middara: The Cave Sickle Queen
Description:
The Cave Sickle Queen Bounty Pack contains a Bounty Book, multiple new Initiative cards, new Combatants, a new Boss Monster, new Monster Loot, and hidden Item cards for you to uncover.

Whether you end up living triumphantly as heroes, or rotting away as dead memories written on the pages of history books. One way or another, Bounties will earn your party fame in Middara.

PERFECTION THROUGH ADVERSITY
Bounty Packs expand the Adventure Mode with insanely hard and uniquely diverse side quests. These Side Quests can be attempted at lower levels than the intended difficulty recommends for an even hard challenge.

Each Bounty Pack adds a side quest that can be attempted during specific moments of the Adventure Mode. The Bounties of Elenia line of Bounty Packs represent all of the horrible monstrosities that threaten the realms of Elenia.

Each Bounty Pack contains a plethora of new content. New tokens, a new Bounty Book, new miniatures, new tiles that expand old sets, new unique loot, new upgrades, as well as optional content to change the possible combatants that might spawn in the Unintentional Malum Core Game and Adventure Expansions.

—description from the publisher

Name: İnkılâp
Description:
Ä°nkÄ±lâp (Turkish for 'Reform') is a 2-5 player economic strategy Euro game, based on modern Turkey's industrialization era in the early 20th century, after the end of World War I.  Players will manage existing state institutions or private industries.  They will benefit from reforms made by the new republican government, and can also pressure the government to make additional reforms to help their economic sector.

In the game, players contribute to the industrialization process of their country by establishing workshops, factories and developing technologies.  The economy will transition from raw materials production to that of more developed industrial products.  Technology & profits drive further economic development and expansion, and success in a given economic field will grant advantages in the path to victory.

Name: Drako Duell
Description:
Promotional game for Kalev Candy Factory.

Collect the 10 Drako-figures per player from candy-packs, print out the cards and play.
Choose 5 cards for each game where each different type of Drako is connected with 2 other types, one is better and another is worse than the current type.
Players have 10 Drakos in duel. Each round players choose simultaneously one Drako-figure. The winning Drako continues the game. Losing Drako goes out.
The game continues until one player runs out of his/her Drakos.
Other player wins.

—user summary

Name: Monster Knights: A 2-Bit Monster Hunting Card Game
Description:
The small village of Vonsterwald was once a bustling tourist attraction, but since monsters from the nearby forests began showing up at night they have scared almost everyone away.  The ones that remain have called on you and your fellow Monster Knights to rid the countryside of the monsters. Will you survive the night, save their village, and become the 2-bit monster hunter of legend?

In Monster Knights: A 2-Bit Monster Hunting Card Game, players take on the roles of monster hunters who have been tasked by the locals of Vonsterwald to save their village from the nightly attacks by legendary monsters the Swamp Monster, the Wolf Monster, the Vampire Monster, and Frankenmonster. To do that, players must work together to heal the Monster Hunters when they take wounds, to move the Monster Hunters around the village, and to use the Monster Hunters to attack the monsters they encounter with crossbows, silver bullet guns, holy relics, and torches. Each monster has a weakness to a certain weapon, which causes more damage to that particular monster. If a location is destroyed, the players lose. If a Monster Hunter dies, the players lose. Only by getting rid of all the monsters will the players win.

-description from designer

Name: Space Jackers: A 2-Bit Space Western Card Game
Description:
In Space Jackers: A 2-Bit Space Western Card Game, players are trying to escape the giant evil space station by making their way through the station and get to their ship, the Centennial Pigeon. To do that, players must draft a team of Rebel cards and use their skills to overcome the various obstacles they encounter to make a path to the ship. The first player to get all 4 of their tokens to the ship wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Kooky Mansion
Description:
Kooky Mansion is a light-hearted loot collecting/scoring card game for 2-4 players. The goal is very simple: be the first player to score 30 points worth of loot. To do that, players must enter the Kooky Mansion either through the Basement OR through the Roof, move up and down the various floors to collect the loot, and then get out of the mansion with the loot to score points. Sounds easy, right? Be warned, the mansion is guarded by a highly intelligent mad scientist, a highly indestructible robot, and a highly insecure sentient alien tentacle all of which can also be moved up and down floors to capture any intruders they encounter! If the players are caught, they are escorted from the mansion and any loot they had collected is lost (scored loot can never be lost). The mansion is full of secret passages that the players can use to avoid the guards and move more quickly up and down floors. Can you avoid capture, snag the loot, and escape the mansion to become the first player to score 30 points?

-description from designer
